availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, policeman. Kentucky native. Married to Susan E. Pearman Shanks in Hardin County, Kentucky, on April 16, 1840. Father of Thomas P. Shanks, William F. Shanks, Samuel R. Shanks, Eugene S. Shanks, James W. Shanks, and Maria J. Shanks. Bricklayer in Jefferson County in 1850. Employed John Fuel as a bricklayer in Louisville in 1850. Policeman in Jefferson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, District 1, p. 13A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Ward 2, p. 445.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Ward 4, p. 427A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Hardin County Marriages, Film #000390788, p. 320 of 487 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "James Campbell Shanks (1818-1891)," Memorial #87006089, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/87006089 (accessed December 9, 2019).
